intro: Alaternus hispanicus, commonly known as Spanish alaternus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in Mediterranean regions. Its leaves are pinnately divided, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Alaternus hispanicus is often found in open habitats such as scrublands and woodland edges.
